title: An 11-Villa Estate in Italy That Dates Back to the 11th Century
text:
Listing of the Day

Location: Tuscany, Italy

Price: €23 million (US$25.06 million)

Constructed in 1085 and known as the Vallombrosa Abbey of the Holy Trinity of Spineto, this spectacular estate was a functioning abbey up until 1830. An important example of Tuscan monasticism, the complex originally took the form of a typical feudal estate, lying at the center of Sarteano’s agricultural, artisanal and spiritual life. With the fall of Siena, the abbey eventually ended up under the rule of the Medici family, according to the property’s agent Roberto Musotti.

In 1830, the estate passed definitively into private hands, being acquired by its current owners in 1989. They immediately set about restoring the entire property, a process which lasted three years for the main house, while the restoration of the old farm buildings scattered around the estate took 11 years in total, incorporating many recovered materials as well as top-of-the-range facilities.

According to Mr. Musotti, "the process was planned and executed with a view to leaving the ancient essence of the site unaltered, working in complete harmony with history and nature."

The estate is so spacious that each of its 11 villas are separated by miles of land, making each one a private haven.

More: This Tuscan Villa Comes With 40 Rooms and a $60 Million Price Tag

Stats

The estate is comprised of a main abbey, 11 independent farmhouse villas, two stables, and a congress hall that can accommodate 200 people. The estate amounts to 40,900 square feet in total, excluding the church, which was consecrated and belongs to the Vatican.

The main abbey features nine double bedrooms and nine bathrooms.

The Abbey estate sits upon 830 hectares of land, much of which is mature forest.

Amenities

The vast estate offers countless options for activities. The 500-plus hectares of woodland, couched within a total of 830 hectares of land, provide the perfect setting for orienteering, free climbing and off-road biking. The natural lake, which covers four hectares, is available for water sports.

When it comes to hosting events, the abbey’s potential is endless. Since 2000, it has been certified for the management of conference and catering activities. Events have included meetings with ministers, an international conference with NASA competitions and sporting events. With its generous spaces and unspoiled natural environment, the estate can easily be used for business events and specialist trainings.

Next to the abbey is a beautiful, consecrated church, available for religious events or atmospheric concerts.

Neighborhood Notes

The estate is located in the municipality of Sarteano, within the Val d'Orcia, which extends from the hills south of Siena to Mount Amiata. The Val d’Orcia is also a UNESCO heritage site.

Sarteano lies in the very center of Italy, halfway between Florence and Rome. It is easy to reach, either from the A1 motorway (the Autostrada del Sole) or the station in Chiusi. With its pure, clean air, peace, quiet, archaeological riches and biodiversity, this Tuscan town is one of the region’s true gems.

Agent: Roberto Musotti, Carratelli Real Estate and Luxury Portfolio
